answers.answer: it takes the average women up to 12 months to get pregnant so don't assume something is wrong. what you're going through is normal. it took me almost a year to get pregnant with my first and over 8 months with my second.
Thank you Megan. So kind of you to say such words. Look forward for happy moments. :(. feels more low due to mood swings at times.

Hi baby,you will get a good news very soon.don't u worry about..my best wishes are always with u my dear...m also ttc from the last 3.5 yrs n now we ve moved to iui.this is our 4th cycle of  iui n am also in tension what will happen this time? This time i also want to get a good news..

Hi!Do you know if your tubes are open or if you have endometriosis? Is your DH's sperm count/quality ok?  I'm 33 and my DH had tried for almost 4 yrs before starting IUI treatment.  We're on our second one right now... My tubes were open, I had lap and they removed mild endo, my DH is fine and we're still not getting prego for some reason.  It takes time and patience! Best of luck and lots of baby dust!! :)

Hi HopefulJust feels scary to go for tube test HSG. :( and i do have a fibriod but outside uterus; i hope it is not blocking my tubes. will gain some strength and try to go for tube test.Thanks a lot for your suggestions.

Hi Baby,I am 31 healthy/active and a non smoker and have been having trouble for 3 years so I feel your frustration.  My husband and I are know on our first cycle of IUI.I highly recommend getting the "dye" test done asap.  I ended up having a tubal pregnancy in Feb 09 and had the left tube removed.  I wish I had of checked this prior to TTC.It's really not that bad, kinda like a pap with menstrual cramps.  It takes like 5 mins and I went straight back to work an hour later.  Just take 2 Advil 1 hour before the test.Keep positive and Tons of Baby dust to you!!

question: Hi FriendsI am 32. With regular 28 day cycle. Ovaulate naturally with 2 peaks on Clearblue Fertility monitor. Its been 8 months I am married. With active sex life; takine pre natal; i dont smoke; no alchohol; take proper diet; and my hormones are fine; no diabetes; still not getting pregnant; this is so frustrating; depressing and devastating; i cant wait longer; any pointers would be of great help.Thank you
title: Not getting pregnant
